overview:
Jason Wilk got his first professional exprience working with Zonbo Media Group China as an online consultant in 2006, where he supplied Chinese executives with directions to take the online media market in China.

While in China, he built and launched his first start-up, 1DaySports.com in August of 2006, a one day deal site, (similar to Woot.com) for sports products online. After running the company for one year and forging multiple marketing partnerships (See Golfbuzz.com, GolfWorld magazine), he sold the business in October of 2007 with running revenues of 100K+.

Shortly after the inception of 1daysports.com, he created the world’s first marketplace for fashion boutiques on the web (butiku.com). Its mission was linking together famous fashion districts of the world by providing easy accessible turn-key e-commerce solutions for store owners. Besides it’s core business of selling product, it is accompanied by a fashion boutique directory and classified section for local/online stores in areas to post events and sales that are happening. The project was acquired in July 2008.

In August 2008, he began TinyComb.com, a Los Angeles based technology news blog focused on mobile, gadget, startup and big tech news. In April of 2009, it was accepted into the prestigious NetShelter Media Network. It has been mentioned by The Wall St. Journal, New York Times, LA Times, TechCrunch, CNET and many more.

He is currently co-founder and CEO of Y Combinator-backed 140Fire.
